intro: Cylindrolobus nutans, commonly known as the nodding cylinder-lobed plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, cylindrical, and lobed leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in botany and horticulture.
